Name: Promenade Beach
Nearest Bus Stand: Pondicherry Bus Station (Villianur Road area) — approx. 2–4 km.
Nearest Airport: Puducherry Airport (domestic) — approx. 5–7 km; Chennai International Airport — ~150–160 km.
Timings: Public promenade area generally accessible 06:00–20:00 (no formal enclosure).
Best Time to Visit: Oct–Mar (cooler weather, pleasant evenings and sunrise).
Accessibility: Paved promenade — wheelchair accessible along Goubert Avenue sections; sandy/rocky in parts. Road access good. Evening vehicle restrictions in some sections.
Guided Tours: Walk/talking tours of White Town often include the Promenade (local guides available).
Parking: Nearby paid/paid-street parking in White Town; charges vary by lot — some municipal/public parking.
Nearby Amenities: Cafés (Le Café etc.), restaurants, shops, benches, public restrooms near White Town.
Special Notes: Lined with heritage landmarks — Gandhi statue, War Memorial, old lighthouse; ideal sunrise/sunset stroll. Puducherry Tourism

Name: Sri Aurobindo Ashram
Nearest Railway Station: Pondicherry Railway Station (PDY) — walking distance (about 1 km depending on exact point).
Timings: Main Ashram building (Samadhi area) usually open 08:00–11:30 and 14:00–18:00 (visitor rules apply; other areas may require passes).
Entry Fee: No entry fee for Samadhi/visitor areas; accommodation at Ashram guest houses is paid (if applicable).
Accessibility: Central Ashram area is accessible by road; quiet precincts with steps and internal paths — some areas may be less wheelchair-friendly.
Guided Tours: Visitor information and guidance available at Ashram Bureau Central; quiet/observance rules must be followed; many foreign-language visitors.
Parking: Limited local parking; best to use city parking and walk.
Nearby Amenities: Cafés in White Town, guest houses, small shops.
Special Notes: One of India’s most famous spiritual communities; strict silence/behavior norms in parts of the Ashram — follow signage and staff guidance. Sri Aurobindo Ashram+1

Name: Auroville / Matrimandir
Nearest Railway Station: Pondicherry Railway Station (PDY) — approx. 10–13 km to Auroville Visitors Centre (distance varies by entry point).
Nearest Bus Stand: Pondicherry Bus Station — ~12–14 km to Visitors Centre.
Nearest Airport: Puducherry Airport — ~15–18 km (depending on route); Chennai Intl — ~150 km.
Timings: Viewing point and visitors centre open most days (pass issue Mon–Sat at Visitors Centre; timings vary — common visit slots include morning and afternoon viewing windows).
Entry Fee: Visitors Centre and viewing-point access: usually free, but Matrimandir inner chamber requires advance booking/passes (free/regulated).
Best Time to Visit: Oct–Mar (pleasant weather for walking/visiting the gardens).
Accessibility: Visitors Centre to Viewing Point ~10–30 min walk; electric shuttle available for those who cannot walk. Matrimandir inner chamber has quiet, strict rules.
Guided Tours: Visitors Centre issues passes and guidance; Auroville offers organized tours and multilingual info.
Nearby Amenities: Auroville visitor facilities — café, bookshop, information desks; guesthouses in Auroville.
Special Notes: Matrimandir is a spiritual/architectural landmark; inner chamber visits are meditative and tightly regulated — get passes early. Auroville is an experimental international township with eco-projects and handicraft outlets. auroville.org+1

Name: Chunnambar / Paradise Beach
Wikipedia: Not a dedicated Wikipedia page for the boat house; Arikamedu/Chunnambar referenced in local guides.
Nearest Railway Station: Pondicherry Railway Station (PDY) — approx. 6–7 km to Chunnambar (varies by route).
Nearest Airport: Puducherry Airport — approx. 20–25 km (road distance varies).
Timings: Boat house & beach access usually daytime hours (approx. 08:00–17:00 / timings may vary seasonally).
Entry Fee: Boat/park entry and boat charges vary — e.g., small boat trips and motorboat charges listed by local authorities; example boating and parking tariffs documented (see source).
Best Time to Visit: Oct–Mar (calm seas, best for boat trips and beach time).
Accessibility: Requires short boat transfer to Paradise Beach (boat ride from Chunnambar Boat House). Not all sections wheelchair-friendly (boat boarding needed).
Guided Tours: Boat-house staff and local guides available; water-activity operators for kayaking, motorboats.
Parking: Paid parking at boat house (two-wheeler, car, bus rates listed locally).
Nearby Amenities: Beach shacks, toilets at boat house, basic restaurants; day-trip facilities.
Special Notes: Paradise Beach is reached by boat through Chunnambar estuary — popular for day trips, sunbathing, and water activities; check tide/boat schedules. Puducherry Tourism+1

Name: Arulmigu Manakula Vinayagar Temple
Official Website: Not official site documented — local tourism pages cover it.
Nearest Railway Station: Pondicherry Railway Station (PDY) — within ~1–2 km (walking distance for many).
Timings: Typical temple timings: morning and evening puja timings (e.g., opens early morning ~05:45am; mid-day closure; reopens in evening) — local pages list approx. 05:45–12:30 & 16:00–21:30 (confirm locally).
Entry Fee: No entry fee; donations permitted for special offerings.
Best Time to Visit: Oct–Mar; festival days (Vinayaka Chaturthi) are especially lively.
Accessibility: Central city location; steps at entrance; limited wheelchair access in some parts.
Guided Tours: Local temple guides available; priests provide rituals in Tamil; some visitor assistance available in English.
Parking: Local street parking; small paid lots nearby.
Nearby Amenities: Shops selling offerings, eateries, cafés in White Town nearby.
Special Notes: Very popular Ganesh temple in city — historic and frequented by locals and tourists. Puducherry Tourism+1

Name: Botanical Garden
Wikipedia: Not always a separate WP entry; local tourism pages.
Nearest Railway Station: Pondicherry Railway Station (PDY) — approx. 4–5 km (varies by garden entrance).
Entry Fee: Small nominal fee (e.g., ₹10–20 for adults; children lower) — check local notice.
Best Time to Visit: Year-round; Oct–Mar preferred for cooler weather.
Accessibility: Walkways inside gardens; generally easy walking but some areas may have steps.
Guided Tours: Local guided options available via tourism counters.
Special Notes: Well-laid-out botanical collections, glasshouse and seasonal flower shows. Puducherry Tourism+1

Name: Arikamedu
Official Website: Archaeological references on state tourism pages; no large dedicated commercial site.
Nearest Railway Station: Pondicherry Railway Station (PDY) — approx. 4–8 km (wiki lists ~4 km from city centre; local guides ~7–8 km depending on route).
Nearest Airport: Chennai Intl is nearest major airport (~150 km); Puducherry airport is farther by road depending on route (~20 km).
Timings: Typically open during daylight hours; exact gate/timing details sometimes Not documented — check local ASI or tourism board before visiting.
Entry Fee: Often free or nominal (some ASI sites may have small ticket fee) — Not documented for current exact fee.
Accessibility: Low-built ruins, uneven ground; not very wheelchair-friendly — wear sturdy shoes.
Guided Tours: Local guides and ASI information panels available at site; English/Tamil guides sometimes available.
Nearby Amenities: Small local shops and eateries in Ariyankuppam area.
Special Notes: Ancient Indo-Roman trade port with Roman amphorae finds — important archaeological significance. Wikipedia+1

Name: Ousteri / Ossudu Lake
Nearest Railway Station: Pondicherry Railway Station (PDY) — approx. 10–12 km depending on entry point.
Best Time to Visit: Nov–Feb (migratory birds and cooler weather); early morning/late afternoon recommended for birdwatching.
Accessibility: Road approach available; viewpoints with basic walking paths; some areas may be uneven.
Guided Tours: Local birding guides and eco-tour operators available seasonally.
Nearby Amenities: Local eateries, basic sanitation at main picnic/view points.
Special Notes: Important wetland; great for birding (migratory species in winter); eco-conservation projects ongoing. Puducherry Tourism+1

Name: Pondicherry Museum
Nearest Railway Station: Pondicherry Railway Station (PDY) — ~2–4 km depending on location in city.
Timings: Official Puducherry art/department lists visiting hours (often Tue–Sun 10:00–17:00; closed Mon). Confirm current schedule with official page.
Entry Fee: Nominal (examples: ₹10 for adults, ₹5 children, foreigners higher ~₹50 — check current notices).
Accessibility: Museum interiors generally accessible; check for specific mobility support.
Guided Tours: Audio guides or local guides possible via museum desk.
Nearby Amenities: Cafés and shops in French Quarter/nearby areas.
Special Notes: Notable Chola bronzes and archaeological collection from the region. art.py.gov.in+1

Name: The French Quarter / White Town
Type: Heritage quarter / Colonial architecture / Food & shopping district
Official Website: Coverage on Incredible India / Puducherry tourism pages (no single official private site).
Nearest Railway Station: Pondicherry Railway Station (PDY) — central, within ~1–3 km.
Timings: Public area — accessible all day; individual attractions & shops have their own timings (cafés open early–late).
Entry Fee: No entry fee to walk the quarter. Individual museums/buildings may have fees.
Accessibility: Mostly pedestrian-friendly flat streets; some cobblestones; wheelchair access in many streets but step entries to some cafes/buildings.
Guided Tours: Walking tours, cycling tours, heritage walks widely available (English/Tamil/French options).
Parking: Limited central parking; best to park outside and walk/cycle.
Nearby Amenities: Boutique cafés, bakeries, restaurants, shops, guesthouses, galleries.
Special Notes: Lovely Indo-French architecture, café culture, heritage houses — a top draw for photography and food. Incredible India+1

Name: Serenity Beach
Official Website: Surf schools and local tourism pages (no single official page).
Wikipedia: Not a dedicated WP page; covered in local guides.
Nearest Railway Station: Pondicherry Railway Station (PDY) — ~6–8 km (about 15–20 min by road).
Timings: Public beach — accessible dawn to dusk; surf schools operate mostly during daylight hours.
Entry Fee: No entry fee; paid surf lessons and rentals available.
Best Time to Visit: Oct–Mar (better surf conditions and cooler weather). Early morning sunrise recommended.
Accessibility: Sandy access; some rocky patches; surf schools provide equipment and guides. Wheelchair access limited on sand.
Guided Tours: Surf schools provide lessons/guides; local guides for beach tours.
Parking: Local parking available near the beach (paid/municipal).
Nearby Amenities: Small cafés, surf cafés, restrooms, weekend bazaar sometimes.
Special Notes: Popular for surfing and sunrise photography; quieter than the city promenade. Thrillophilia+1

Name: Basilica of the Sacred Heart of Jesus
Nearest Railway Station: Pondicherry Railway Station (PDY) — within ~1–2 km (city central).
Timings: Church open daily (examples: 06:00–18:00; Mass times vary — check parish site for exact schedule).
Best Time to Visit: Year-round; special celebrations on Easter/Christmas draw crowds.
Accessibility: Road access and steps/ramps vary; check locally for mobility access.
Guided Tours: Parish staff and guides sometimes available; explanatory pamphlets may be offered.
Nearby Amenities: Cafés and shops in central area.
Special Notes: Fine Gothic architecture with stained glass and lit evening façade — popular photo spot and active parish.
